title: Modifying inference_cfg.yaml has no effect on tracklet performance.

labels.name: backwards compatibility
labels.description: issues concerning prior to current versions

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this? - [X] I have searched the existing issues ### Bug description Hello, I have been using DLC for a while now, and everything usually goes smoothly. Training and evaluation seem to work correctly, throughout each version of the software I have used. Recently however, I have been having an issue with video analysis and creating tracklets. The general issue that I am experiencing is that modifications made to the inference_cfg.yaml files make no difference to tracking performance. I used to be able to modify some of the values in that file to influence the tracking and remove some 'bad' tracklets from the data to make refinement easier, or to add additional tracklets when very few tracklets are produced. In version 2.2rc3, very few tracklets were produced, and I was unable to improve performance through modifying the inference_cfg.yaml file. This prompted me to update to a newer version of DLC, 2.2.0.4 and try to track here. The same issue occurs. modifying the inference_cfg.yaml file does not impact the tracklets at all. However, this version of DLC does not include a GUI option to 'overwrite tracklet data' when modifying the inference_cfg like previous versions I have used. Not sure what the issue is here, and I was hoping someone could help me out. Thanks! ### Operating System Windows 10 ### DeepLabCut version 2.2.0.4 (and 2.2rc3) ### DeepLabCut mode multi animal ### Device type GPU (RTX 3080Ti) ### Steps To Reproduce 1. Train like normal (works fine) 2. Evaluate like normal (works fine) 3. Analyze video (and produce tracklet data) 4. Refine tracklets and view tracklets in the GUI 5. Modify inference_cfg.yaml for my current iteration (14). Even modifying to 'impossible standards' (like min hits 1000) does nothing. 6. Analyse video again to produce new tracklets (deleting created pickles from earlier just to be sure) 7. Refine tracklets and view tracklets in the GUI 8. Results are the same. ### Relevant log output _No response_ ### Anything else? my config.yaml:
